page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: Let us take a walk down the tow path from Muirtown Bridge.Glenalbyn Distillery across the Basin has been closed for some years.GL11,the gatelifter,lies at the wharf wall. Moored next to it are the Duke of Normandy(the Canal tug boat)and the fishery protection vessel.Donkeys are grazing on our left.Beyond,the toll house on the Clachnaharry road is boarded up.Further along are two piles of lock gates made by Lewis's,Aberdeen shipbuilders.At the Clachnaharry Works electricians,engineers,blacksmiths and joiners work to keep the canal as it was long ago.Two Buckie trawlers are in the locks,going home from the West Coast.The men throw us some cod roe. The signalman by the swing bridge calls down.The Kyle train passes.At the Sea Lock Mr.Mackenzie opens the gates by pressing a switch.
